title: Quiz 8: Pharmacology & Legal Frameworks
description: Test your knowledge on drug laws, schedules, and pharmacological definitions.

questions.question: Which Act of Parliament in Kenya regulates the sale and distribution of poisons and drugs?
questions.explanation: Cap 244 is the Pharmacy and Poisons Act.

questions.question: Schedule 1 (S.1) poisons must be stored in a locked cupboard.
questions.explanation: S.1 poisons require secure storage in a locked cupboard.

questions.question: Controlled drugs (DDA) in a hospital must be stored in a ___BLANK___ cupboard.
questions.explanation: Controlled drugs require a double-lock system (a locked container within a locked cupboard).
questions.hint: Two keys are better than one.

questions.question: Match the drug name type with its example:
questions.explanation: Generic is the official name; Trade is the brand; Chemical is the structure.

questions.question: Which of the following are standards used to judge drug preparations? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Purity, Potency, Bioavailability, Efficacy, and Safety are the key drug standards.
questions.hint: Cost is not a quality standard.

questions.question: What is the term for a genetically determined, unexpected response to a drug?
questions.explanation: An idiosyncratic reaction is an unusual response unique to the individual's genetics.

questions.question: The Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act was enacted in which year?
A nurse can administer a controlled drug without a witness if the ward is busy.
questions.explanation: Controlled drugs MUST always be checked and administered in the presence of a witness (usually another nurse) to prevent error and diversion.

questions.question: What does 'Bioavailability' refer to?

options.text: The degree to which a drug is absorbed and transported to the site of action
The shelf life of the drug
The chemical purity of the drug

questions.explanation: Bioavailability measures how much of the drug actually becomes available to the body tissues.

questions.question: Match the pharmacokinetics term with its definition:
questions.explanation: Absorption = entry; Metabolism = breakdown; Excretion = exit.
